name: cfpdf
description:
Manipulates existing PDF documents. The following list describes some of the
 tasks you can perform with the cfpdf tag:
 Merge several PDF documents into one PDF document.
 Extract pages from multiple PDF documents and generate a new PDF document.
 Linearize multipage PDF documents for faster display.
 Encrypt or decrypt PDF files for security.

params.name: action
params.description: The action to take.

params.name: ascending
params.description:
Order in which the PDF files are sorted:
 yes: files are sorted in ascending order
 no: files are sorted in descending order

params.name: copyfrom
params.description: The filename of the PDF document from which to copy the watermark

params.name: destination
params.description:
The pathname of the modified PDF document.
 If the destination file exists, you must set the overwrite attribute to yes.
 If the destination file does not exist, ColdFusion creates it as long as
 the parent directory exists. (optional)

params.name: directory
params.description:
Specify the directory of the PDF documents to merge.
 You must specify either the directory or the source.
 If you specify the directory, you must also specify the order.

params.name: encrypt
params.description: Specify the type of encryption used on the source PDF document

params.name: flatten
params.description:
Specify whether the output file is flattened:
 yes: the formatting is removed and the file is flattened
 no: the format of the source PDF is maintained in the output file.

params.name: foreground
params.description:
Specify whether the watermark is placed in the foreground of the PDF document:
 yes: the watermark appears in the foreground
 no: the watermark appears in the background

params.name: image
params.description:
Specify the image used as a watermark.
 You can specify a filename or a ColdFusion image variable.

params.name: info
params.description:
Specify the structure variable for relevant information, for example, #infoStruct#.
 ColdFusion ignores read only information, such as the creation date, application used to create
 the PDF document, and encryption parameters.

params.name: isBase64
params.description:
Specify whether the image used a watermark is in Base64 format:
 yes: the image is in Base64 format
 no: the image is not in Base64 format

params.name: keepbookmark
params.description:
Specify whether bookmarks from the source PDF
 documents are retained in the merged document:
 yes: the bookmarks are retained
 no: the bookmarks are removed

params.name: name
params.description:
Specify the PDF document variable name, for example, myPDFdoc.
 If the source is a PDF document variable, you cannot specify the
 name attribute again; you can write the modified PDF document
 to the destination.

params.name: newOwnerPassword
params.description: Specify the password for the owner of the PDF document.

params.name: newUserPassword
params.description: Specify the password for the user of the PDF document.

params.name: opacity
params.description:
Specify the opacity of the watermark.
 Valid values are integers in the range 0 (transparent)
 through 10 (opaque).

params.name: order
params.description:
Specify the order in which the PDF documents
 in the directory are merged:
 name: orders the documents alphabetically
 time: orders the documents by timestamp

params.name: overwrite
params.description:
Specify whether to overwrite the destination file:
 yes: overwrites the destination file
 no: does not overwrite the destination file

params.name: password
params.description: Specify the owner or user password of the source PDF document, if it exists.

params.name: permissions
params.description:
Specify the type of permissions on the PDF document:
 AllowPrintHigh
 AllowPrintLow
 AllowModify
 AllowCopy
 AllowAdd
 AllowSecure
 AllowModifyAnnotations
 AllowExtract
 AllowFillIn
 all
 none
 Except for all or none, you can specify a
 comma separated list of permissions. (optional)

params.name: position
params.description:
Specify the position on the page where
 the watermark is placed. The position represents the
 top-left corner of the watermark.
 Specify the x and y coordinates; for example 50,30.

params.name: rotation
params.description:
Specify the degree of rotation of
 the watermark image on the page; for example, 30.

params.name: showonprint
params.description:
Specify whether the watermark is printed with
 the PDF document:
 yes: the watermark is printed with the PDF document
 no: the watermark is not printed with the PDF document

params.name: source
params.description:
Specify the source. The source can be:
 The pathname to a PDF document; for example, c:\work\myPDF.pdf
 A PDF document variable in memory that is generated by the
 cfdocument tag or the cfpdf tag; for example, #myPDFdoc#
 The binary content of PDF document variable.

params.name: type
params.description:
Specify the type to remove from the source PDF document:
 attachment
 bookmark
 watermark

params.name: version
params.description: (write) Specify the version of the PDF document to write.

params.name: transparent
params.description:
Specifies whether the image background is transparent or opaque: format=png only
 * yes: the background is transparent.
 * no: the background is opaque.

params.name: resolution
params.description:
Image quality used to generate thumbnail images:
 * high: use high resolution (uses more memory).
 * low: use low resolution.

params.name: stoponerror
params.description:
Valid only if the directory attribute is specified. If the specified directory contains files other then ColdFusion-readable PDF files, ColdFusion either stops merge process or continues.
 * yes: stops the merge process if invalid PDF files exist in the specified directory.
 * no: continues the merge process even if invalid files exist in the specified directory.

params.name: inputfiles
params.description: Structure that maps the PDF source files to the input variables in the DDX file, or a string of elements and their pathname.

params.name: scale
params.description: Size of the thumbnail relative to the source page. The value represents a percentage from 1 through 100.

params.name: imageprefix
params.description: Prefix used for each image thumbnail file generated. The image filenames use the format: imagePrefix_page_n.format.

params.name: outputfiles
params.description: Structure that contains the output files in the DDX file or string as keys and the pathname to the result file as the value.

params.name: pages
params.description: Page or pages in the source PDF document on which to perform the action. You can specify multiple pages and page ranges as follows: "1,6-9,56-89,100, 110-120".

params.name: ddxfile
params.description: Owner or user password of the source PDF document, if the document is password-protected.

params.name: saveoption
params.description:
Save options for the PDF output:
 * full: normal save (default)
 * incremental: required to save modifications to a signed PDF document.
 * linear: for faster display.

params.name: format
params.description: File type of thumbnail image output

params.name: hires
params.description: Sets a high resolution for the thumbnail if set to yes.

params.name: maxScale
params.description: Specifies the maximum scale of the thumbnail

params.name: maxBreadth
params.description: CF9+ Specifies maximum width of the thumbnail

params.name: maxLength
params.description: Specifies the maximum length of the thumbnail

params.name: compressTIFFs
params.description: Compress thumbnail which are in TIFF format.

params.name: overridepage
params.description: Specify whether to override page or not

params.name: package
params.description: Create PDF packages

params.name: hScale
params.description: Horizontal scale of the image to be modified. Valid values are hscale<1.

params.name: vScale
params.description: Vertical scale of the image to be modified. Valid values are vscale>0.

params.name: noBookMarks
params.description: CF9+ Remove bookmarks from PDF document

params.name: noAttachments
params.description: CF9+ Removes all attachments from PDF documents.

params.name: noComments
params.description: Remove comments from PDF document

params.name: noJavaScripts
params.description: CF9+ Remove all document level JavaScript actions

params.name: noLinks
params.description: Remove external cross-references

params.name: noMetadata
params.description: CF9+ Remove document information and metadata

params.name: noThumbnails
params.description: Remove embedded page thumbnails

params.name: noFonts
params.description: CF9+ Remove font styling

params.name: algo
params.description: CF9+ Specifies the algorithm for image downsampling.

params.name: topMargin
params.description: Specifies the value of the top margin

params.name: leftMargin
params.description: Specifies the value of the left margin

params.name: rightMargin
params.description: Specifies the value of the right margin

params.name: bottomMargin
params.description: Specifies the value of the bottom margin

params.name: numberFormat
params.description: Specify the numbering format for PDF pages in the footer.

params.name: align
params.description: Aligns the header and footer in PDF.

params.name: honourspaces
params.description: Set this option to "true" if you need characters to be converted to spaces.

params.name: addQuads
params.description: Add the position or quadrants of the thumbnail

params.name: text
params.description: Specify Text Value

params.name: useStructure
params.description: CF9+ Specify whether to use structure or not

params.name: jpgdpi
params.description: CF9+

params.name: encodeAll
params.description: Encode streams that are not encoded to optimize page content

coldfusion.notes:
CF9+ Added new attributes: jpgdpi, maxBreadth, noAttachments, leftMargin, algo, noMetadata, noBookMarks, noJavaScripts, useStructure, noFonts.
 CF11 added validatesignature and readsignaturefields. CF2016 added sanitize, export, import, archive, addAttachments, addStamp, redact

examples.title: Script Syntax - Create Thumbnail
examples.description: Creates a JPG thumbnail from a PDF file
examples.code:
cfpdf(
    action="thumbnail",
    source=expandPath( "./myFile.pdf" ),
    destination=expandPath( "./thumbnails/"),
    resolution="high",
    overwrite="yes",
    pages="1",
    scale="75",
    transparent="no"
);
examples.result: Creates a file called myFile_page_1.jpg in the /thumbnails/ directory
